Lunarpine thought he'd heard something, no someone calling to 
him. "What was that?" He wondered, smelling the air again. He 
followed the scent to her. He could still hear her words in his head 
when she called to him. "What's become of you?" He thought, curiosity 
flooding his mind.

He heard a voice over his comm. Veratis wanted an update on the 
situation. "I found her" he replied, getting her back was going to be 
the diffivult part.

Three clean up drones aproached scanning her. A needle came out of 
the first one and headed for Ice. 

"No" Lunarpine yelled as he grabbed hold of it, It was trying to 
neutralise the virus. He knew that if that happened she'd be dead. 
Veratis reprogrammed 2 of the drones to help get her back. Lunarpine 
picked Ice up on his back and with the help of the drones began 
carrying her back.

-- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She was about to pass out where she lay. She felt a presance close 
to 
> her. She opened her mind and heard the thought of Lunarpine. He was 
> close to her. She smiled. She could read in his thoughts that he 
> still cared for her. A smiled crossed her face. She sned out the 
> mental message,"I'm over here."
> Then she slipped into sleep. The snow half covered her, but the red 
> puddle was growing under her. It was ver visible, despite the 
falling 
> snow.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lunarpine fought his way through ice and snow to find her. 
Nothing 
> would
> > stop him from finding her, He'd travelled to far and worked to 
hard 
> to bring
> > her back to let her succome to a virus. The bloodstains in the 
snow 
> were
> > getting larger. Her wounds had opened worse. The half wolf was 
> determined to
> > return her to Veratis' base without any harm.
> > 
> > Meanwhile Foxfingers flew across the sea to the country where 
> they'd landed.
> > He was far enough away from Predacon territory to risk a 
> transmission.
> > "Foxfingers to home, I'm on my way back with lots of goodies." His
> > hoverboard switched into high gear as he streaked across the 
water.
> > 
> > Veratis heard the transmission and replied in kind. "Where the 
> underworld
> > have you been? You should have been back long ago." He hesitated 
to 
> deliver
> > the bad news to him, Things were falling apart before his very 
> eyes, The
> > virus was loose, Lunarpine still hadn't found Ice and Lady Hawk 
> still hadn't
> > returned. The bleak news echoed through his memory like a chiming 
> bell.
> > Things just couldn't get much worse.
> > 
> > Foxfingers slowed down when he heard the news. He remembered the 
> tracking
> > device on his shoulder. "You've accompanied me far enough Preds." 
> He flew
> > low and dropped it on the icy beach. The tracking device still 
> functioned,
> > The Predacons could track him this far, and he wasn't worried 
about 
> anything
> > else.
> >
